duties_responsibilities.duty: Performing detailed engineering of pipeline facilities, regulation and meter runs, pig launchers, interconnects, relief systems, measurement systems, compressor station, gas conditioning facilities, gas processing, upstream production facilities, etc.
Sizing calculations for relief valves, control valves, separators, compressors, and other equipment required for projects.
Support the development of equipment specifications such as compressors, pumps, separators, process skids, etc.
Developing process models for facility projects and managing P&ID sets.
Participating in field/site walks and coordinating field investigation work for engineering and construction.
Preparing project funding documents, including cost estimates, equipment bid summaries, and authorization requests.

education_certification.credential: B.S. in Chemical, Mechanical, or Petroleum Engineering with coursework related to the job responsibilities.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in the oil, gas, and utility sectors including project engineering and design or operating company experience.
Engineering Intern (EI) certification or the ability to obtain within 1 year of hire.
Familiarity with gas codes and regulations, CAD, Microsoft Office, and Process Modeling Software.
Legal authorization to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship.
Preferred: 4 - 8 years of relevant work experience, consulting engineering, plant-based environment.
Preferred: Strong client relationships and the ability to develop and foster ongoing relationships.
